text:
The following error can be found in the JavaScript console:

Error: this.ownerDocument.vdom.firstChild has no properties
Source File: http://localhost:8888/bxe/relaxng/NodeVAL.js
Line: 236

The same error is thrown upon start-up already.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text: It works for the homepage, but not for XHTML documents.
creator: andreas@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text:
The reason is that relative schema URIs are not resolved correctly:


grammar ns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
-
	<!--
 include Lenya schema, for Lenya assets within xhtml 
-->
<include
href="/default/authoring/schemas/fallback/lenya/resources/schemas/lenya.rng"/>
<!-- include original XHTML transitional schema -->
-
	<include href="xhtml/xhtml-basic.rng">

creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> It works for the homepage, but not for XHTML documents.

I tried to edit and save the homepage of the default pub and it was the same
error reported.

creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> The reason is that relative schema URIs are not resolved correctly:
> 
> 
> grammar ns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
> -
> 	<!--
>  include Lenya schema, for Lenya assets within xhtml 
> -->
> <include
> href="/default/authoring/schemas/fallback/lenya/resources/schemas/lenya.rng"/>
> <!-- include original XHTML transitional schema -->
> -
> 	<include href="xhtml/xhtml-basic.rng">

The homepage.rng looks like this when loaded in the browser:

<grammar ns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
  <include href="fallback://lenya/resources/schemas/xhtml.rng"/>
</grammar>

Strange, on my machine it looks like this:

<grammar ns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<include
href="/default/authoring/schemas/fallback/lenya/modules/xhtml/schemas/xhtml.rng"/>
</grammar>
creator: andreas@apache.org

text: On my machine it works for homepage and xhtml now. Maybe you need a "build clean"?
creator: andreas@apache.org
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
Sorry for the noise. The bug was fixed in the few hours since my last svn up.
Thanks Andreas!

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
Actually the bug was perfectly valid, since it worked only for the homepage and
not for xhtml ... so thanks for reporting :)
